note: ## Reading List: Indirectly Supervised Natural Language Processing (up to 2023

title: This list provides a diverse selection of articles exploring various aspects of indirectly supervised NLP, including
Foundations and Concepts:**
**"Unsupervised Learning for Natural Language Processing"** by Jurafsky and Martin (2000): A foundational chapter introducing unsupervised learning in NLP
**"Weakly Supervised Learning for Natural Language Processing"** by Zhao et al
A comprehensive overview of weakly supervised NLP, including indirect supervision
**"A Survey of Indirect Supervision for Natural Language Processing"** by Liu et al
A recent survey focusing on various indirect supervision techniques
**"Distant Supervision for Relation Extraction via Bootstrapping"** by Mintz et al
A seminal work introducing distant supervision for relation extraction
**"Distant Supervision for Textual Entailment Recognition"** by Zou et al
Applying distant supervision to textual entailment
**"Distant Supervision for Relation Extraction: A Survey"** by Riedel et al
A survey of distant supervision techniques for relation extraction
**"Weak Supervision: A New Frontier for Data-Intensive Applications"** by Ratner et al
A comprehensive overview of weak supervision, including its applications in NLP
**"Snorkel: A System for Weak Supervision"** by Ratner et al
Introducing Snorkel, a system for building weak supervision models
**"Weakly Supervised Learning for Natural Language Understanding"** by Zhang et al
A survey of weakly supervised learning techniques for NLP tasks
**"Semi-Supervised Learning for Natural Language Processing: An Overview"** by Zhu and Goldberg (2009): A comprehensive overview of semi-supervised learning in NLP
**"Semi-Supervised Sequence Modeling with Cross-View Training"** by He et al
Applying semi-supervised learning to sequence modeling tasks
**"Semi-Supervised Learning for Text Classification with Word Embeddings"** by Dai et al
Using word embeddings to improve semi-supervised text classification
**"Active Learning for Natural Language Processing: A Survey"** by Settles
A survey of active learning techniques for NLP
**"Active Learning for Relation Extraction with Weak Supervision"** by Xu et al
Combining active learning with weak supervision for relation extraction
**"Active Learning for Text Classification with Deep Neural Networks"** by Yang et al
Applying active learning to deep learning models for text classification
**"Indirect Supervision for Sentiment Analysis"** by Wang et al
Applying indirect supervision to sentiment analysis

author.literal: **"Weakly Supervised Machine Translation"** by Sennrich et al.

title: **"Indirect Supervision for Question Answering"** by Chen et al
Using indirect supervision for question answering systems
Applying weak supervision to named entity recognition
**"The Future of Indirect Supervision for Natural Language Processing"** by Liu et al
A discussion on future research directions in indirectly supervised NLP

**Note:** This list is not exhaustive and represents a starting point for exploring the field of indirectly supervised NLP. You can find more relevant articles by searching for keywords like "indirect supervision
container-title: "weak supervision," "distant supervision," "semi-supervised learning," and "active learning" in conjunction with specific NLP tasks
